data.name: Article 25 - Data Protection by Design and by Default
data.description: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures for ensuring that, by default, only personal data which are necessary for each specific purpose of the processing are processed.

tests.title: Root MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for the root account
tests.more_info: The root account should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication.
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the root account and then use an IAM user for managing services

results.message: An MFA device was not found for the root account

tests.title: Users MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account
tests.more_info: User accounts should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: S3 Bucket All Users Policy
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket policies do not allow global write, delete, or read permissions
tests.more_info: S3 buckets can be configured to allow the global principal to access the bucket via the bucket policy. This policy should be restricted only to known users or accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Remove wildcard principals from the bucket policy statements.
tests.remediation_description: Bucket policy will be deleted for affected buckets.

tests.title: Root Account In Use
tests.description: Ensures the root account is not being actively used
tests.more_info: The root account should not be used for day-to-day account management. IAM users, roles, and groups should be used instead.
tests.recommended_action: Create IAM users with appropriate group-level permissions for account access. Create an MFA token for the root account, and store its password and token generation QR codes in a secure place.

results.message: Root account was last used 0 days ago

tests.title: Instance IAM Role
tests.description: Ensures EC2 instances are using an IAM role instead of hard-coded AWS credentials
tests.more_info: IAM roles should be assigned to all instances to enable them to access AWS resources. Using an IAM role is more secure than hard-coding AWS access keys into application code.
tests.recommended_action: Attach an IAM role to the EC2 instance

tests.title: S3 Bucket All Users ACL
tests.description: Ensures S3 buckets do not allow global write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: S3 buckets can be configured to allow anyone, regardless of whether they are an AWS user or not, to write objects to a bucket or delete objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global all users policies on all S3 buckets and ensure both the bucket ACL is configured with least privileges.
tests.remediation_description: Bucket ACL will be modified to be private to bucket owner.

tests.title: IAM Role Policies
tests.description: Ensures IAM role policies are properly scoped with specific permissions
tests.more_info: Policies attached to IAM roles should be scoped to least-privileged access and avoid the use of wildcards.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all IAM roles are scoped to specific services and API calls.

results.message: Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy

tests.title: SSM Agent Active All Instances
tests.description: Ensures SSM agents are installed and active on all servers
tests.more_info: SSM allows for centralized monitoring of all servers and should be activated on all EC2 instances.
tests.recommended_action: Install SSM on all servers and ensure it is active.

data.name: Article 30 - Records of Processing Activities
data.description: The controller shall maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility.

tests.title: CloudTrail Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail should be enabled for all regions in order to detect suspicious activity in regions that are not typically used.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail for all regions and ensure that at least one region monitors global service events

results.message: CloudTrail is not configured to monitor global services

tests.title: Config Service Enabled
tests.description: Ensures the AWS Config Service is enabled to detect changes to account resources
tests.more_info: The AWS Config Service tracks changes to a number of resources in an AWS account and is invaluable in determining how account changes affect other resources and in recovery in the event of an account intrusion or accidental configuration change.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the AWS Config Service for all regions and resources in an account. Ensure that it is properly recording and delivering logs.

results.message: Config Service is not monitoring global services

tests.title: VPC Flow Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging
tests.more_info: VPC flow logs record all traffic flowing in to and out of a VPC. These logs are critical for auditing and review after security incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC

results.message: VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled

tests.title: ELB Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures load balancers have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to ELB endpoints is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources.Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable ELB request logging

tests.title: CloudFront Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to CloudFront distributions is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources. Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudFront request logging.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Logging
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 bucket logging helps maintain an audit trail of                 access that can be used in the event of a security                 incident.
tests.recommended_action: Enable bucket logging for each S3 bucket.

tests.title: EKS Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all EKS cluster logs are being sent to CloudWatch
tests.more_info: EKS supports routing of cluster event and audit logs to CloudWatch, including control plane logs. All logs should be sent to CloudWatch for security analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable all EKS cluster logs to be sent to CloudWatch with proper log retention limits.
tests.remediation_description: EKS logging will be enabled for all supported services.

data.name: Article 32 - Security of Processing
data.description: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures that consider the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons.

tests.title: CloudTrail Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail should be enabled for all regions in order to detect suspicious activity in regions that are not typically used.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail for all regions and ensure that at least one region monitors global service events

results.message: CloudTrail is not configured to monitor global services

tests.title: RDS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for RDS instances which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the databases.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: CloudTrail Encryption
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail encryption at rest is enabled for logs
tests.more_info: CloudTrail log files contain sensitive information about an account and should be encrypted at rest for additional protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail log encryption through the CloudTrail console or API
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Cloud trails will be enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for Redshift clusters which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Insecure CloudFront Protocols
tests.description: Detects the use of insecure HTTPS SSL/TLS protocols for use with HTTPS traffic between viewers and CloudFront
tests.more_info: CloudFront supports SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols for use with HTTPS traffic, but only TLSv1.1 or higher should be used unless there is a valid business justification to support the older, insecure SSLv3.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between viewers and CloudFront is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher.

tests.title: Encrypted AMI
tests.description: Ensures EBS-backed AMIs are configured to use encryption
tests.more_info: AMIs with unencrypted data volumes can be used to launch unencrypted instances that place data at risk.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all AMIs have encrypted EBS volumes.

tests.title: CloudFront HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions are configured to redirect non-HTTPS traffic to HTTPS.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, CloudFront distributions can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.
tests.recommended_action: Remove HTTP-only listeners from distributions.
tests.remediation_description: CloudFront distribution will be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.

tests.title: ELB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: EBS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume is used for a root volume, the instance must be launched from an AMI that has been encrypted as well.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for EBS volumes.

tests.title: SQS Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected SQS queues will be enabled.

tests.title: KMS Key Policy
tests.description: Validates the KMS key policy to ensure least-privilege access.
tests.more_info: KMS key policies should be designed to limit the number of users who can perform encrypt and decrypt operations. Each application should use its own key to avoid over exposure.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the KMS key policy to remove any wildcards and limit the number of users and roles that can perform encrypt and decrypt operations using the key.

tests.title: DynamoDB KMS Encryption
tests.description: Ensures DynamoDB tables are encrypted using a customer-owned KMS key.
tests.more_info: DynamoDB tables can be encrypted using AWS-owned or customer-owned KMS keys. Customer keys should be used to ensure control over the encryption seed data.
tests.recommended_action: Create a new DynamoDB table using a CMK KMS key.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted DynamoDB table will be configured to use either KMS encryption with AWS managed CMK, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: EFS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that EFS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EFS offers data at rest encryption using keys managed through AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Encryption of data at rest can only be enabled during file system creation. Encryption of data in transit is configured when mounting your file system. 1. Backup your data in not encrypted efs 2. Recreate the EFS and select 'Enable encryption of data at rest'

tests.title: Workgroup Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Athena workgroups are configured to encrypt all data at rest.
tests.more_info: Athena workgroups support full server-side encryption for all data at rest which should be enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption at rest for all Athena workgroups.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected workgroups will be enabled.

tests.title: RDS Snapshot Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for RDS snapshots to ensure encryption of data at rest.
tests.more_info: AWS provides encryption for RDS snapshots which should be enabled to ensure that all data at rest is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Copy the snapshot to a new snapshot that is encrypted and delete the old snapshot.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensures object encryption is enabled on S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 object encryption provides fully-managed encryption of all objects uploaded to an S3 bucket.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CMK KMS-based encryption for all S3 buckets.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted bucket will be configured to use either AES-256 encryption, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Encrypted Domain
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are encrypted with KMS
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be encrypted to ensure data at rest is secured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure encryption-at-rest is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be encrypted with KMS.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Node To Node Encryption
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domain traffic is encrypted in transit between nodes
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should use node-to-node encryption to ensure data in transit remains encrypted using TLS 1.2.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure node-to-node encryption is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to use node-to-node encryption.

tests.title: ElasticSearch HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are configured to enforce HTTPS connections
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured to enforce HTTPS connections for all clients to ensure encryption of data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure HTTPS connections are enforced for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to enforce HTTPS.

tests.title: XRay Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CMK-based encryption is enabled for XRay traces.
tests.more_info: AWS XRay supports default encryption based on an AWS-managed KMS key as well as encryption using a customer managed key (CMK). For maximum security, the CMK-based encryption should be used.
tests.recommended_action: Update XRay encryption configuration to use a CMK.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected XRay traces will be enabled.
